snippet: Jorge Mario Bergoglio, 76, to be called Francis, will break ground as a Jesuit and Latin American. But his views on gay marriage, abortion and other issues make him a conservative choice to lead the church.
abstract: Man in the News Profile of Jorge Mario Bergoglio, the new pope who will be called Francis; he is, in some ways a history-making pontiff, as he is the first pope from the Jesuit order and the first from Latin America; he is also a conventional choice, a theological conservative of Italian ancestry who backs Vatican positions on abortion, gay marriage and other major issues; he is well known as a passionate defender of the poor and disenfranchised.

byline.original: By EMILY SCHMALL and LARRY ROHTER
byline.contributor: Emily Schmall reported from Buenos Aires, and Larry Rohter from Portland, Ore. Simon Romero contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, and  Mauricio Rabuffetti from Montevideo, Uruguay.

lead_paragraph: Jorge Mario Bergoglio, 76, to be called Francis, will break ground as a Jesuit and Latin American. But his views on gay marriage, abortion and other issues make him a conservative choice to lead the church.
